    • Method Detail

      • refresh

        public void refresh(boolean clear,
                    boolean blockUntilFinished)
        Refreshes this browser.

        This means a new thread will start that asks the current directory for its contents.

        Parameters:
        clear - whether this request should first clear the current contents.

        Eventually -- once the threads finish -- the contents of this browser will exactly match the contents of the current directory. But consider the case of adding a new folder to the displayed directory: if we call refresh(true) then all the other files will be removed and the list will repopulate from scratch. This results in a flickering GUI for the user (or worse, if the file system is slow to respond: such as a slow FTP connection). But if we call refresh(false) then there is no flicker. New files are added where appropriate, and at the end a call to replaceAll() guarantees that removed files will also be noticed.

        blockUntilFinished - if true then this method won't return until the refresh is complete.

      • getListModel

        public javax.swing.ListModel getListModel()
        Returns:
        the directory contents. Note that it will change until isLoading() returns false, and these changes will not occur on the event dispatch thread.

      • getSelectionModel

        public IOSelectionModel getSelectionModel()
        Returns:
        The model for which files are currently selected in the current directory.

      • getLocationHistory

        public LocationHistory getLocationHistory()
        Returns:
        the model for which directory is currently being displayed. If this is changed then the ListModel and IOSelectionModel will both be changed.

      • getGraphicCache

        public GraphicCache getGraphicCache()

        public boolean isLoading()
        Returns:
        whether the ListModel is still being generated. If you add ChangeListeners to this object: they will be notified when this method changes its return value;

      • setRefreshOnWindowActivation

        public void setRefreshOnWindowActivation(boolean refreshOnWindowActivation)
        Control whether this component refreshes its directory listing when it observes the containing window has reactivated.

        For example: if someone leaves this dialog and navigates to the file system, then delete/renames files, and switches back to this component, then it makes sense to refresh automatically. However if the user is navigated, for example, a company-specific server (cloud), then it is less likely the file system changed.

        Parameters:
        refreshOnWindowActivation - whether this component refreshes when the containing window is reactivated.
        See Also:
        isRefreshOnWindowActivation()

      • isRefreshOnWindowActivation

        public boolean isRefreshOnWindowActivation()
        Returns:
        whether this component refreshes its directory listing when it observes the containing window has reactivated.
        See Also:
        setRefreshOnWindowActivation(boolean)
